]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[?1034h[root@vm0 11:06:26]# man logger
[?1049h[?1h=LOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[m
[1mNAME[0m[m
       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[m
[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
       log module.[m
[m
[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
              is attempted.[m
[m
       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[m
       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[m
       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
              sage.[m
[m
       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
              Display a help text and exit.[m
[m
       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[m
       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[m
       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[m
       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
              Display version information and exit.[m
[m
       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[m
       [4mmessage[24m[m
[7m Manual page logger(1) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[Kuu[Kss[Kee[Krr[K[K[K[K[Kff[Kaa[Kcc[Kii[Kll[Kii[Ktt[Kyy[K[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4m[7mfacility[27m[24m[4m.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 [7mfacility[27m.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H              Write the message to log; if not specified, and the [4m-f[24m flag is not  provided,  standard  input  is[m
              logged.[m
[m
       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[m
[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
       Valid [7mfacility[27m names are:[m
[m
              [1mauth[0m[m
              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
              [1mcron[0m[m
              [1mdaemon[0m[m
              [1mftp[0m[m
              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
              [1mlpr[0m[m
              [1mmail[0m[m
              [1mnews[0m[m
              [1msyslog[0m[m
              [1muser[0m[m
              [1muucp[0m[m
              [1mlocal0[0m[m
                to[m
              [1mlocal7[0m[m
              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[m
       Valid level names are:[m
[m
              [1memerg[0m[m
              [1malert[0m[m
              [1mcrit[0m[m
              [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarning[0m[m
              [1mnotice[0m[m
              [1minfo[0m[m
              [1mdebug[0m[m
              [1mpanic[0m     deprecated synonym for [1memerg[0m[m
              [1merror[0m     deprecated synonym for [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarn[0m      deprecated synonym for [1mwarning[0m[m
[m
       For the priority order and intended purposes of these facilities and levels, see [1msyslog[0m(3).[m
[m

[41;1H[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
[42;1H       Valid facility names are:[m

[44;1H              [1mauth[0m[m
[45;1H              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
[46;1H              [1mcron[0m[m
[47;1H              [1mdaemon[0m[m
[48;1H              [1mftp[0m[m
[49;1H              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m

[51;1H              [1mmail[0m[m
[52;1H              [1mnews[0m[m
[53;1H              [1msyslog[0m[m
[54;1H              [1muser[0m[m
[55;1H              [1muucp[0m[m
[56;1H              [1mlocal0[0m[m
[57;1H                to[m
[58;1H              [1mlocal7[0m[m
[59;1H              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[60;1H[m
[61;1H       Valid level names are:[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H              [1memerg[0m[m
[64;1H              [1malert[0m[m
[65;1H              [1mcrit[0m[m
[66;1H[1;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[2;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[3;1H[m
[4;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[5;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[6;1H              sage.[m
[7;1H[m
[8;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[9;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[10;1H[m
[11;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[12;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[13;1H              cally  or as a [4m[7mfacility[27m[24m[4m.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[14;1H              in the local3 [7mfacility[27m.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[15;1H[m
[16;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[17;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[18;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[19;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[20;1H[m
[21;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[22;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[23;1H[m
[24;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[25;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[28;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[29;1H[m
[30;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[31;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[32;1H[m
[33;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[34;1H[m
[35;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[36;1H              Write the message to log; if not specified, and the [4m-f[24m flag is not  provided,  standard  input  is[m
[37;1H              logged.[m
[38;1H[m
[39;1H       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
[42;1H       Valid [7mfacility[27m names are:[m
[43;1H[m
[44;1H              [1mauth[0m[m
[45;1H              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
[46;1H              [1mcron[0m[m
[47;1H              [1mdaemon[0m[m
[48;1H              [1mftp[0m[m
[49;1H              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
[50;1H              [1mlpr[0m[m
[51;1H              [1mmail[0m[m
[52;1H              [1mnews[0m[m
[53;1H              [1msyslog[0m[m
[54;1H              [1muser[0m[m
[55;1H              [1muucp[0m[m
[56;1H              [1mlocal0[0m[m
[57;1H                to[m
[58;1H              [1mlocal7[0m[m
[59;1H              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[60;1H[m
[61;1H       Valid level names are:[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H              [1memerg[0m[m
[64;1H              [1malert[0m[m
[65;1H              [1mcrit[0m[m
[66;1H              [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarning[0m[m
              [1mnotice[0m[m
              [1minfo[0m[m
              [1mdebug[0m[m
              [1mpanic[0m     deprecated synonym for [1memerg[0m[m
              [1merror[0m     deprecated synonym for [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarn[0m      deprecated synonym for [1mwarning[0m[m
[m
       For the priority order and intended purposes of these facilities and levels, see [1msyslog[0m(3).[m
[m
[1mEXAMPLES[0m[m
[7m Manual page logger(1) line 45/126 88% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       logger System rebooted[m
[7m Manual page logger(1) line 46/126 89% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       logger -p local0.notice -t HOSTIDM -f /dev/idmc[m
       logger -n loghost.example.com System rebooted[m
[m
[1mSEE[0m [1mALSO[0m[m
       [1msyslog[0m(3), [1msyslogd[0m(8)[m
[m
[1mSTANDARDS[0m[m
       The [1mlogger[0m command is expected to be IEEE Std 1003.2 ("POSIX.2") compatible.[m
[m
[1mAVAILABILITY[0m[m
       The  logger  command is part of the util-linux package and is available from Linux Kernel Archive ‚ü®ftp://[m
       ftp.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/util-linux/‚ü©.[m
[m

]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 11:07:57]# logger ^C
]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 11:08:02]# man logger
[?1049h[?1h=LOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[m
[1mNAME[0m[m
       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[m
[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
       log module.[m
[m
[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
              is attempted.[m
[m
       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[m
       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[m
       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
              sage.[m
[m
       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
              Display a help text and exit.[m
[m
       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[m
       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[m
       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[m
       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
              Display version information and exit.[m
[m
       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[m
       [4mmessage[24m[m
[7m Manual page logger(1) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K66[K~~[K              Write the message to log; if not specified, and the [4m-f[24m flag is not  provided,  standard  input  is[m
              logged.[m
[m
       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[m
[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
       Valid facility names are:[m
[m
              [1mauth[0m[m
              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
              [1mcron[0m[m
              [1mdaemon[0m[m
              [1mftp[0m[m
              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
              [1mlpr[0m[m
              [1mmail[0m[m
              [1mnews[0m[m
              [1msyslog[0m[m
              [1muser[0m[m
              [1muucp[0m[m
              [1mlocal0[0m[m
                to[m
              [1mlocal7[0m[m
              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[m
       Valid level names are:[m
[m
              [1memerg[0m[m
              [1malert[0m[m
              [1mcrit[0m[m
              [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarning[0m[m
              [1mnotice[0m[m
              [1minfo[0m[m
              [1mdebug[0m[m
              [1mpanic[0m     deprecated synonym for [1memerg[0m[m
              [1merror[0m     deprecated synonym for [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarn[0m      deprecated synonym for [1mwarning[0m[m
[m
       For the priority order and intended purposes of these facilities and levels, see [1msyslog[0m(3).[m
[m
[1mEXAMPLES[0m[m
       logger System rebooted[m
       logger -p local0.notice -t HOSTIDM -f /dev/idmc[m
       logger -n loghost.example.com System rebooted[m
[m
[1mSEE[0m [1mALSO[0m[m
       [1msyslog[0m(3), [1msyslogd[0m(8)[m
[m
[1mSTANDARDS[0m[m
       The [1mlogger[0m command is expected to be IEEE Std 1003.2 ("POSIX.2") compatible.[m
[m
[1mAVAILABILITY[0m[m
       The  logger  command is part of the util-linux package and is available from Linux Kernel Archive ‚ü®ftp://[m
       ftp.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/util-linux/‚ü©.[m
[m

[66;1H[K[7m Manual page logger(1) line 1/126 60% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[Kll[Kee[Kvv[Kee[Kll[K[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.[24m[4m[7mlevel[27m[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H              Write the message to log; if not specified, and the [4m-f[24m flag is not  provided,  standard  input  is[m
              logged.[m
[m
       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[m
[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1m[7mLEVEL[27m[0m[1mS[0m[m
       Valid facility names are:[m
[m
              [1mauth[0m[m
              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
              [1mcron[0m[m
              [1mdaemon[0m[m
              [1mftp[0m[m
              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
              [1mlpr[0m[m
              [1mmail[0m[m
              [1mnews[0m[m
              [1msyslog[0m[m
              [1muser[0m[m
              [1muucp[0m[m
              [1mlocal0[0m[m
                to[m
              [1mlocal7[0m[m
              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[m
       Valid [7mlevel[27m names are:[m
[m
              [1memerg[0m[m
              [1malert[0m[m
              [1mcrit[0m[m
              [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarning[0m[m
              [1mnotice[0m[m
              [1minfo[0m[m
              [1mdebug[0m[m
              [1mpanic[0m     deprecated synonym for [1memerg[0m[m
              [1merror[0m     deprecated synonym for [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarn[0m      deprecated synonym for [1mwarning[0m[m
[m
       For the priority order and intended purposes of these facilities and [7mlevel[27ms, see [1msyslog[0m(3).[m

]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 11:09:13]# man logger
[?1049h[?1h=LOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[m
[1mNAME[0m[m
       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[m
[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
       log module.[m
[m
[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
              is attempted.[m
[m
       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[m
       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[m
       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
              sage.[m
[m
       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
              Display a help text and exit.[m
[m
       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[m
       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[m
       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[m
       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
              Display version information and exit.[m
[m
       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[m
       [4mmessage[24m[m
[7m Manual page logger(1) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[Ktt[Kaa[Kgg[K[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use da[7mtag[27mram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--[0m[1m[7mtag[27m[0m [4m[7mtag[27m[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4m[7mtag[27m[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H              Write the message to log; if not specified, and the [4m-f[24m flag is not  provided,  standard  input  is[m
              logged.[m
[m
       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[m
[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
       Valid facility names are:[m
[m
              [1mauth[0m[m
              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
              [1mcron[0m[m
              [1mdaemon[0m[m
              [1mftp[0m[m
              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
              [1mlpr[0m[m
              [1mmail[0m[m
              [1mnews[0m[m
              [1msyslog[0m[m

]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 11:09:34]# logger -p user.error -t "foo" "Unable to write to file /tmp/foo"[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[1P[1P[1P[1P[1P[1P[1P[1P[1P[1@l[1@o[1P[1P[1P[1@l[1@o[1@c[1@a[1@l[1@7[1@.[1@w[1@a[1@r[1@n[1@i[1@n[1@g[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[1P[C[1P[1P[1@m[1@s[1@g[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"[1P"W"h"e"r"e" "t"h"i"s" "m"s"g" "w"i"l"l" "b"e" "s"e"n"t"?"^C
]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 11:10:16]# man loge[Kger
[?1049h[?1h=LOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[m
[1mNAME[0m[m
       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[m
[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
       log module.[m
[m
[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
              is attempted.[m
[m
       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[m
       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[m
       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
              sage.[m
[m
       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
              Display a help text and exit.[m
[m
       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[m
       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[m
       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[m
       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[m
       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
              Display version information and exit.[m
[m
       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[m
       [4mmessage[24m[m
[7m Manual page logger(1) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[Kpp[Krr[Koo[Kcc[Kee[Kss[Kss[K[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the process ID of the logger process with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H[1;1HLOGGER(1)                                         User Commands                                        LOGGER(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       logger - a shell command interface to the syslog(3) system log module[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mlogger[0m [options] [message][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[11;1H       log module.[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[14;1H       [1m-n[0m, [1m--server[0m [4mserver[24m[m
[15;1H              Write to the specified remote syslog [4mserver[24m instead of to the  builtin  syslog  routines.   Unless[m
[16;1H              [1m--udp[0m or [1m--tcp[0m is specified the logger will first try to use UDP, but if it fails a TCP connection[m
[17;1H              is attempted.[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H       [1m-d[0m, [1m--udp[0m[m
[20;1H              Use datagram (UDP) only.  By default the connection is tried to [4msyslog[24m port defined  in  /etc/ser‚Äê[m
[21;1H              vices, which is often [4m514[24m.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H       [1m-T[0m, [1m--tcp[0m[m
[24;1H              Use  stream  (TCP)  only.   By  default  the  connection  is  tried to [4msyslog-conn[24m port defined in[m
[25;1H              /etc/services, which is often [4m601[24m.[m
[26;1H[m
[27;1H       [1m-P[0m, [1m--port[0m [4mport[24m[m
[28;1H              Use the specified [4mport[24m.  When this option is not specified, the port defaults to  syslog  for  udp[m
[29;1H              and to syslog-conn for tcp connections.[m
[30;1H[m
[31;1H       [1m-i[0m, [1m--id[0m[m
[32;1H              Log the [7mprocess[27m ID of the logger [7mprocess[27m with each line.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       [1m-f[0m, [1m--file[0m [4mfile[24m[m
[35;1H              Log  the  contents of the specified [4mfile[24m.  This option cannot be combined with a command-line mes‚Äê[m
[36;1H              sage.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       [1m-h[0m, [1m--help[0m[m
[39;1H              Display a help text and exit.[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m
[42;1H              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[43;1H              cally  or as a [4mfacility.level[24m pair.  For example, [1m-p[0m [4mlocal3.info[24m logs the message as informational[m
[44;1H              in the local3 facility.  The default is [4muser.notice[24m.[m
[45;1H[m
[46;1H       [1m-S[0m, [1m--size[0m [4msize[24m[m
[47;1H              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m
[48;1H              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[49;1H              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[50;1H[m
[51;1H       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[52;1H              Output the message to standard error as well as to the system log.[m
[53;1H[m
[54;1H       [1m-t[0m, [1m--tag[0m [4mtag[24m[m
[55;1H              Mark every line to be logged with the specified [4mtag[24m.[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       [1m-u[0m, [1m--socket[0m [4msocket[24m[m
[58;1H              Write to the specified [4msocket[24m instead of to the builtin syslog routines.[m
[59;1H[m
[60;1H       [1m-V[0m, [1m--version[0m[m
[61;1H              Display version information and exit.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H       [1m--[0m     End the argument list.  This is to allow the [4mmessage[24m to start with a hyphen (-).[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [4mmessage[24m[m
[66;1H              Write the message to log; if not specified, and the [4m-f[24m flag is not  provided,  standard  input  is[m
              logged.[m
[m
       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[m
[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
       Valid facility names are:[m
[m
              [1mauth[0m[m
              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
              [1mcron[0m[m
              [1mdaemon[0m[m
              [1mftp[0m[m
              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace [7mprocess[27m, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
              [1mlpr[0m[m
              [1mmail[0m[m
              [1mnews[0m[m
              [1msyslog[0m[m
              [1muser[0m[m
              [1muucp[0m[m
              [1mlocal0[0m[m
                to[m
              [1mlocal7[0m[m
              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[m
       Valid level names are:[m
[m
              [1memerg[0m[m
              [1malert[0m[m
              [1mcrit[0m[m
              [1merr[0m[m

              logged.[m
[m
       The [1mlogger[0m utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.[m
[m
[1mFACILITIES[0m [1mAND[0m [1mLEVELS[0m[m
       Valid facility names are:[m
[m
              [1mauth[0m[m
              [1mauthpriv[0m   for security information of a sensitive nature[m
              [1mcron[0m[m
              [1mdaemon[0m[m
              [1mftp[0m[m
              [1mkern[0m       cannot be generated from userspace process, automatically converted to [1muser[0m[m
              [1mlpr[0m[m
              [1mmail[0m[m
              [1mnews[0m[m
              [1msyslog[0m[m
              [1muser[0m[m
              [1muucp[0m[m
              [1mlocal0[0m[m
                to[m
              [1mlocal7[0m[m
              [1msecurity[0m   deprecated synonym for [1mauth[0m[m
[m
       Valid level names are:[m
[m
              [1memerg[0m[m
              [1malert[0m[m
              [1mcrit[0m[m
              [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarning[0m[m
              [1mnotice[0m[m
              [1minfo[0m[m
              [1mdebug[0m[m
              [1mpanic[0m     deprecated synonym for [1memerg[0m[m
              [1merror[0m     deprecated synonym for [1merr[0m[m
              [1mwarn[0m      deprecated synonym for [1mwarning[0m[m
[m
       For the priority order and intended purposes of these facilities and levels, see [1msyslog[0m(3).[m
[m
[1mEXAMPLES[0m[m
       logger System rebooted[m
       logger -p local0.notice -t HOSTIDM -f /dev/idmc[m
       logger -n loghost.example.com System rebooted[m
[m
[1mSEE[0m [1mALSO[0m[m
       [1msyslog[0m(3), [1msyslogd[0m(8)[m
[m
[1mSTANDARDS[0m[m
       The [1mlogger[0m command is expected to be IEEE Std 1003.2 ("POSIX.2") compatible.[m
[m
[1mAVAILABILITY[0m[m
       The  logger  command is part of the util-linux package and is available from Linux Kernel Archive ‚ü®ftp://[m
       ftp.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/util-linux/‚ü©.[m

[HM       [1m-s[0m, [1m--stderr[0m[m
[HM[m
[HM              that the receiver supports the max size as well, otherwise messages may become truncated.[m
[HM              used  and  specified in RFC 3164. When selecting a maximum message size, it is important to ensure[m
[HM              Sets the maximum permitted message size. The default is 1KiB, which  is  the  limit  traditionally[m

[HM              Enter the message into the log with the specified [4mpriority[24m.  The priority may be specified numeri‚Äê[m
[HM       [1m-p[0m, [1m--priority[0m [4mpriority[24m[m

[HM       log module.[m
[HM       [1mlogger[0m  makes  entries  in the system log.  It provides a shell command interface to the [1msyslog[0m(3) system[m
[HM[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m

[?1049h[?1h=JOURNALCTL(1)                                      journalctl                                      JOURNALCTL(1)[m
[m
[1mNAME[0m[m
       journalctl - Query the systemd journal[m
[m
[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
       [1mjournalctl[0m [OPTIONS...] [MATCHES...][m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       [1mjournalctl[0m may be used to query the contents of the [1msystemd[0m(1) journal as written by [1msystemd-[0m[m
       [1mjournald.service[0m(8).[m
[m
       If called without parameters, it will show the full contents of the journal, starting with the oldest[m
       entry collected.[m
[m
       If one or more match arguments are passed, the output is filtered accordingly. A match is in the format[m
       "FIELD=VALUE", e.g.  "_SYSTEMD_UNIT=httpd.service", referring to the components of a structured journal[m
       entry. See [1msystemd.journal-fields[0m(7) for a list of well-known fields. If multiple matches are specified[m
       matching different fields, the log entries are filtered by both, i.e. the resulting output will show only[m
       entries matching all the specified matches of this kind. If two matches apply to the same field, then[m
       they are automatically matched as alternatives, i.e. the resulting output will show entries matching any[m
       of the specified matches for the same field. Finally, the character "+" may appears as a separate word[m
       between other terms on the command line. This causes all matches before and after to be combined in a[m
       disjunction (i.e. logical OR).[m
[m
       As shortcuts for a few types of field/value matches, file paths may be specified. If a file path refers[m
       to an executable file, this is equivalent to an "_EXE=" match for the canonicalized binary path.[m
       Similarly, if a path refers to a device node then match is added for the kernel name of the device[m
       ("_KERNEL_DEVICE="). Also, matches for the kernel names of all the parent devices are added[m
       automatically. Device node paths are not stable across reboots, therefore match for the current boot id[m
       ("_BOOT_ID=") is always added as well. Note that only the log entries for the existing device nodes maybe[m
       queried by providing path to the device node.[m
[m
       Additional constraints may be added using options [1m--boot[0m, [1m--unit=[0m, etc, to further limit what entries[m
       will be shown (logical AND).[m
[m
       Output is interleaved from all accessible journal files, whether they are rotated or currently being[m
       written, and regardless of whether they belong to the system itself or are accessible user journals.[m
[m
       The set of journal files which will be used can be modified using the [1m--user[0m, [1m--system[0m, [1m--directory[0m, and[m
       [1m--file[0m options, see below.[m
[m
       All users are granted access to their private per-user journals. However, by default, only root and users[m
       who are members of a few special groups are granted access to the system journal and the journals of[m
       other users. Members of the the "systemd-journal", "adm", and "wheel" groups can read all journal files.[m
       Note that the two latter groups traditionally have additional privileges specified by the distribution.[m
       Members of the "wheel" group can often perform administrative tasks.[m
[m
       The output is paged through [1mless[0m by default, and long lines are "truncated" to screen width. The hidden[m
       part can be viewed by using the left-arrow and right-arrow keys. Paging can be disabled; see the[m
       [1m--no-pager[0m option and the "Environment" section below.[m
[m
       When outputting to a tty, lines are colored according to priority: lines of level ERROR and higher are[m
       colored red; lines of level NOTICE and higher are highlighted; other lines are displayed normally.[m
[m
[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
       The following options are understood:[m
[m
       [1m--no-full[0m, [1m--full[0m, [1m-l[0m[m
           Ellipsize fields when they do not fit in available columns. The default is to show full fields,[m
           allowing them to wrap or be truncated by the pager, if one is used.[m
[m
           The old options [1m-l[0m/[1m--full[0m are not useful anymore, except to undo [1m--no-full[0m.[m
[m
       [1m-a[0m, [1m--all[0m[m
[7m Manual page journalctl(1) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[Kbb[Koo[Koo[Ktt[K[1;1HJOURNALCTL(1)                                      journalctl                                      JOURNALCTL(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       journalctl - Query the systemd journal[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mjournalctl[0m [OPTIONS...] [MATCHES...][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mjournalctl[0m may be used to query the contents of the [1msystemd[0m(1) journal as written by [1msystemd-[0m[m
[11;1H       [1mjournald.service[0m(8).[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H       If called without parameters, it will show the full contents of the journal, starting with the oldest[m
[14;1H       entry collected.[m
[15;1H[m
[16;1H       If one or more match arguments are passed, the output is filtered accordingly. A match is in the format[m
[17;1H       "FIELD=VALUE", e.g.  "_SYSTEMD_UNIT=httpd.service", referring to the components of a structured journal[m
[18;1H       entry. See [1msystemd.journal-fields[0m(7) for a list of well-known fields. If multiple matches are specified[m
[19;1H       matching different fields, the log entries are filtered by both, i.e. the resulting output will show only[m
[20;1H       entries matching all the specified matches of this kind. If two matches apply to the same field, then[m
[21;1H       they are automatically matched as alternatives, i.e. the resulting output will show entries matching any[m
[22;1H       of the specified matches for the same field. Finally, the character "+" may appears as a separate word[m
[23;1H       between other terms on the command line. This causes all matches before and after to be combined in a[m
[24;1H       disjunction (i.e. logical OR).[m
[25;1H[m
[26;1H       As shortcuts for a few types of field/value matches, file paths may be specified. If a file path refers[m
[27;1H       to an executable file, this is equivalent to an "_EXE=" match for the canonicalized binary path.[m
[28;1H       Similarly, if a path refers to a device node then match is added for the kernel name of the device[m
[29;1H       ("_KERNEL_DEVICE="). Also, matches for the kernel names of all the parent devices are added[m
[30;1H       automatically. Device node paths are not stable across reboots, therefore match for the current boot id[m
[31;1H       ("_BOOT_ID=") is always added as well. Note that only the log entries for the existing device nodes maybe[m
[32;1H       queried by providing path to the device node.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       Additional constraints may be added using options [1m--boot[0m, [1m--unit=[0m, etc, to further limit what entries[m
[35;1H       will be shown (logical AND).[m
[36;1H[m
[37;1H       Output is interleaved from all accessible journal files, whether they are rotated or currently being[m
[38;1H       written, and regardless of whether they belong to the system itself or are accessible user journals.[m
[39;1H[m
[40;1H       The set of journal files which will be used can be modified using the [1m--user[0m, [1m--system[0m, [1m--directory[0m, and[m
[41;1H       [1m--file[0m options, see below.[m
[42;1H[m
[43;1H       All users are granted access to their private per-user journals. However, by default, only root and users[m
[44;1H       who are members of a few special groups are granted access to the system journal and the journals of[m
[45;1H       other users. Members of the the "systemd-journal", "adm", and "wheel" groups can read all journal files.[m
[46;1H       Note that the two latter groups traditionally have additional privileges specified by the distribution.[m
[47;1H       Members of the "wheel" group can often perform administrative tasks.[m
[48;1H[m
[49;1H       The output is paged through [1mless[0m by default, and long lines are "truncated" to screen width. The hidden[m
[50;1H       part can be viewed by using the left-arrow and right-arrow keys. Paging can be disabled; see the[m
[51;1H       [1m--no-pager[0m option and the "Environment" section below.[m
[52;1H[m
[53;1H       When outputting to a tty, lines are colored according to priority: lines of level ERROR and higher are[m
[54;1H       colored red; lines of level NOTICE and higher are highlighted; other lines are displayed normally.[m
[55;1H[m
[56;1H[1mOPTIONS[0m[m
[57;1H       The following options are understood:[m
[58;1H[m
[59;1H       [1m--no-full[0m, [1m--full[0m, [1m-l[0m[m
[60;1H           Ellipsize fields when they do not fit in available columns. The default is to show full fields,[m
[61;1H           allowing them to wrap or be truncated by the pager, if one is used.[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H           The old options [1m-l[0m/[1m--full[0m are not useful anymore, except to undo [1m--no-full[0m.[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       [1m-a[0m, [1m--all[0m[m
[66;1H[1;1HJOURNALCTL(1)                                      journalctl                                      JOURNALCTL(1)[m
[2;1H[m
[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       journalctl - Query the systemd journal[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mSYNOPSIS[0m[m
[7;1H       [1mjournalctl[0m [OPTIONS...] [MATCHES...][m
[8;1H[m
[9;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[10;1H       [1mjournalctl[0m may be used to query the contents of the [1msystemd[0m(1) journal as written by [1msystemd-[0m[m
[11;1H       [1mjournald.service[0m(8).[m
[12;1H[m
[13;1H       If called without parameters, it will show the full contents of the journal, starting with the oldest[m
[14;1H       entry collected.[m
[15;1H[m
[16;1H       If one or more match arguments are passed, the output is filtered accordingly. A match is in the format[m
[17;1H       "FIELD=VALUE", e.g.  "_SYSTEMD_UNIT=httpd.service", referring to the components of a structured journal[m
[18;1H       entry. See [1msystemd.journal-fields[0m(7) for a list of well-known fields. If multiple matches are specified[m
[19;1H       matching different fields, the log entries are filtered by both, i.e. the resulting output will show only[m
[20;1H       entries matching all the specified matches of this kind. If two matches apply to the same field, then[m
[21;1H       they are automatically matched as alternatives, i.e. the resulting output will show entries matching any[m
[22;1H       of the specified matches for the same field. Finally, the character "+" may appears as a separate word[m
[23;1H       between other terms on the command line. This causes all matches before and after to be combined in a[m
[24;1H       disjunction (i.e. logical OR).[m
[25;1H[m
[26;1H       As shortcuts for a few types of field/value matches, file paths may be specified. If a file path refers[m
[27;1H       to an executable file, this is equivalent to an "_EXE=" match for the canonicalized binary path.[m
[28;1H       Similarly, if a path refers to a device node then match is added for the kernel name of the device[m
[29;1H       ("_KERNEL_DEVICE="). Also, matches for the kernel names of all the parent devices are added[m
[30;1H       automatically. Device node paths are not stable across re[7mboot[27ms, therefore match for the current [7mboot[27m id[m
[31;1H       ("_[7mBOOT[27m_ID=") is always added as well. Note that only the log entries for the existing device nodes maybe[m
[32;1H       queried by providing path to the device node.[m
[33;1H[m
[34;1H       Additional constraints may be added using options [1m--[0m[1m[7mboot[27m[0m, [1m--unit=[0m, etc, to further limit what entries[m
[35;1H       will be shown (logical AND).[m
[36;1H[m
[37;1H       Output is interleaved from all accessible journal files, whether they are rotated or currently being[m
[38;1H       written, and regardless of whether they belong to the system itself or are accessible user journals.[m
[39;1H[m
[40;1H       The set of journal files which will be used can be modified using the [1m--user[0m, [1m--system[0m, [1m--directory[0m, and[m
[41;1H       [1m--file[0m options, see below.[m
[42;1H[m
[43;1H       All users are granted access to their private per-user journals. However, by default, only root and users[m
[44;1H       who are members of a few special groups are granted access to the system journal and the journals of[m
[45;1H       other users. Members of the the "systemd-journal", "adm", and "wheel" groups can read all journal files.[m
[46;1H       Note that the two latter groups traditionally have additional privileges specified by the distribution.[m
