[30;1H       See the html documentation for this feature.[m
[31;1H[m
[32;1H[1mTEMPLATES[0m[m
[33;1H       Every output in rsyslog uses templates - this holds true for files, user messages and so on.  Tem‚Äê[m
[34;1H       plates  compatible  with  the stock syslogd formats are hardcoded into rsyslogd. If no template is[m
[35;1H       specified, we use one of these hardcoded templates. Search for "template_" in  syslogd.c  and  you[m
[36;1H       will find the hardcoded ones.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       A  template  consists  of  a  template  directive,  a  name, the actual template text and optional[m
[39;1H       options. A sample is:[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H              [1m$template[0m [1mMyTemplateName,"\7Text[0m [1m%property%[0m [1msome[0m [1mmore[0m [1mtext\n",<options>[0m[m
[42;1H[m
[43;1H       The "$template" is the template directive. It tells rsyslog that this line  contains  a  template.[m
[44;1H       The  backslash is an escape character. For example, \7 rings the bell (this is an ASCII value), \n[m
[45;1H       is a new line. The set in rsyslog is a bit restricted currently.[m
[46;1H[m
[47;1H       All text in the template is used literally, except for things  within  percent  signs.  These  are[m
[48;1H       properties and allow you access to the contents of the syslog message. Properties are accessed via[m
[49;1H       the property replacer and it can for example pick a substring or do date-specific formatting. More[m
[50;1H       on this is the PROPERTY REPLACER section of this manpage.[m
[51;1H[m
[52;1H       To escape:[m
[53;1H          % = \%[m
[54;1H          \ = \\ --> '\' is used to escape (as in C)[m
[55;1H       $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%\n"[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       Properties can be accessed by the property replacer (see there for details).[m
[58;1H[m
[59;1H       [1mPlease[0m  [1mnote[0m  [1mthat[0m  [1mtemplates[0m [1mcan[0m [1malso[0m [1mby[0m [1mused[0m [1mto[0m [1mgenerate[0m [1mselector[0m [1mlines[0m [1mwith[0m [1mdynamic[0m [1mfile[0m [1mnames.[0m[m
[60;1H       For example, if you would like to split syslog messages from different hosts  to  different  files[m
[61;1H       (one per host), you can define the following template:[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H              [1m$template[0m [1mDynFile,"/var/log/system-%HOSTNAME%.log"[0m[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       This  template can then be used when defining an output selector line. It will result in something[m
[66;1H[1;1H   [1m[7mProperty[27m[0m[1m-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
[2;1H       [7mProperty[27m-based  filters  are  unique to rsyslogd. They allow to filter on any [7mproperty[27m, like HOST‚Äê[m
[3;1H       NAME, syslogtag and msg.[m
[4;1H[m
[5;1H       A [7mproperty[27m-based filter must start with a colon in column 0. This tells rsyslogd that  it  is  the[m
[6;1H       new filter type. The colon must be followed by the [7mproperty[27m name, a comma, the name of the compare[m
[7;1H       operation to carry out, another comma and then the value to compare against. This  value  must  be[m
[8;1H       quoted.   There  can  be spaces and tabs between the commas. [7mProperty[27m names and compare operations[m
[9;1H       are case-sensitive, so "msg" works, while "MSG" is an invalid [7mproperty[27m name. In brief, the  syntax[m
[10;1H       is as follows:[m
[11;1H[m
[12;1H              :[7mproperty[27m, [!]compare-operation, "value"[m
[13;1H[m
[14;1H       The following compare-operations are currently supported:[m
[15;1H[m
[16;1H              [1mcontains[0m[m
[17;1H                     Checks if the string provided in value is contained in the [7mproperty[27m[m
[18;1H[m
[19;1H              [1misequal[0m[m
[20;1H                     Compares  the  "value"  string  provided and the [7mproperty[27m contents. These two values[m
[21;1H                     must be exactly equal to match.[m
[22;1H[m
[23;1H              [1mstartswith[0m[m
[24;1H                     Checks if the value is found exactly at the beginning of the [7mproperty[27m value[m
[25;1H[m
[26;1H              [1mregex[0m[m
[27;1H                     Compares the [7mproperty[27m against the provided regular expression.[m
[28;1H[m
[29;1H   [1mExpression-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
[30;1H       See the html documentation for this feature.[m
[31;1H[m
[32;1H[1mTEMPLATES[0m[m
[33;1H       Every output in rsyslog uses templates - this holds true for files, user messages and so on.  Tem‚Äê[m
[34;1H       plates  compatible  with  the stock syslogd formats are hardcoded into rsyslogd. If no template is[m
[35;1H       specified, we use one of these hardcoded templates. Search for "template_" in  syslogd.c  and  you[m
[36;1H       will find the hardcoded ones.[m
[37;1H[m
[38;1H       A  template  consists  of  a  template  directive,  a  name, the actual template text and optional[m
[39;1H       options. A sample is:[m
[40;1H[m
[41;1H              [1m$template[0m [1mMyTemplateName,"\7Text[0m [1m%[0m[1m[7mproperty[27m[0m[1m%[0m [1msome[0m [1mmore[0m [1mtext\n",<options>[0m[m
[42;1H[m
[43;1H       The "$template" is the template directive. It tells rsyslog that this line  contains  a  template.[m
[44;1H       The  backslash is an escape character. For example, \7 rings the bell (this is an ASCII value), \n[m
[45;1H       is a new line. The set in rsyslog is a bit restricted currently.[m
[46;1H[m
[47;1H       All text in the template is used literally, except for things  within  percent  signs.  These  are[m
[48;1H       properties and allow you access to the contents of the syslog message. Properties are accessed via[m
[49;1H       the [7mproperty[27m replacer and it can for example pick a substring or do date-specific formatting. More[m
[50;1H       on this is the [7mPROPERTY[27m REPLACER section of this manpage.[m
[51;1H[m
[52;1H       To escape:[m
[53;1H          % = \%[m
[54;1H          \ = \\ --> '\' is used to escape (as in C)[m
[55;1H       $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%\n"[m
[56;1H[m
[57;1H       Properties can be accessed by the [7mproperty[27m replacer (see there for details).[m
[58;1H[m
[59;1H       [1mPlease[0m  [1mnote[0m  [1mthat[0m  [1mtemplates[0m [1mcan[0m [1malso[0m [1mby[0m [1mused[0m [1mto[0m [1mgenerate[0m [1mselector[0m [1mlines[0m [1mwith[0m [1mdynamic[0m [1mfile[0m [1mnames.[0m[m
[60;1H       For example, if you would like to split syslog messages from different hosts  to  different  files[m
[61;1H       (one per host), you can define the following template:[m
[62;1H[m
[63;1H              [1m$template[0m [1mDynFile,"/var/log/system-%HOSTNAME%.log"[0m[m
[64;1H[m
[65;1H       This  template can then be used when defining an output selector line. It will result in something[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 302/663 56% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       like "/var/log/system-localhost.log"[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 303/663 56% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
   [1mTemplate[0m [1moptions[0m[m
       The <options> part is optional. It carries options influencing the template as whole.  See details[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 306/663 56% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       below.  Be  sure  NOT  to mistake template options with [7mproperty[27m options - the later ones are pro‚Äê[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 307/663 57% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       cessed by the [7mproperty[27m replacer and apply to a SINGLE [7mproperty[27m, only (and not the whole template).[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 309/663 57% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       Template options are case-insensitive. Currently defined are:[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 310/663 57% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
              sql    format the string suitable for a SQL statement in MySQL format.  This  will  replace[m
                     single  quotes ("'") and the backslash character by their backslash-escaped counter‚Äê[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 313/663 58% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K                     part ("¬¥" and "\") inside each field. Please note that in MySQL  configuration,  the[m
                     NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES  mode  must  be turned off for this format to work (this is the[m
                     default).[m
[m
              stdsql format the string suitable for a SQL statement that is to be sent  to  a  standards-[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 318/663 59% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K                     compliant  sql  server.  This  will replace single quotes ("'") by two single quotes[m
                     ("''") inside each field.  You must use stdsql together with MySQL if in MySQL  con‚Äê[m
                     figuration the NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES is turned on.[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 321/663 60% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       Either  the  [1msql[0m or [1mstdsql[0m option [1mMUST[0m be specified when a template is used for writing to a data‚Äê[m
       base, otherwise injection might occur. Please note that due to the unfortunate fact  that  several[m
       vendors  have  violated the sql standard and introduced their own escape methods, it is impossible[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 325/663 61% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       to have a single option doing all the work.  So you yourself must make  sure  you  are  using  the[m
       right format.  [1mIf[0m [1myou[0m [1mchoose[0m [1mthe[0m [1mwrong[0m [1mone,[0m [1myou[0m [1mare[0m [1mstill[0m [1mvulnerable[0m [1mto[0m [1msql[0m [1minjection.[0m[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 328/663 62% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       Please  note  that the database writer *checks* that the sql option is present in the template. If[m
       it is not present, the write database action is disabled.  This is to guard you against accidental[m
       forgetting  it  and  then  becoming vulnerable to SQL injection. The sql option can also be useful[m
       with files - especially if you want to import them into a database on another machine for  perfor‚Äê[m
       mance  reasons.  However,  do  NOT use it if you do not have a real need for it - among others, it[m
       takes some toll on the processing time. Not much, but on a really busy system you might notice  it[m
       ;)[m
[m
       The default template for the write to database action has the sql option set.[m
[m
   [1mTemplate[0m [1mexamples[0m[m
       Please  note  that  the  samples  are split across multiple lines. A template MUST NOT actually be[m
       split across multiple lines.[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 345/663 64% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       A template that resembles traditional syslogd file output:[m
[m
              $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME%[m
              %syslogtag%%msg:::drop-last-lf%\n"[m
[m
       A template that tells you a little more about the message:[m
[m
              $template precise,"%syslogpriority%,%syslogfacility%,%timegenerated%,%HOSTNAME%,[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 353/663 65% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K              %syslogtag%,%msg%\n"[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 354/663 65% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       A template for RFC 3164 format:[m
[m
              $template RFC3164fmt,"<%PRI%>%TIMESTAMP% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%"[m
[m
       A template for the format traditionally used for user messages:[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 361/663 66% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K              $template usermsg," XXXX%syslogtag%%msg%\n\r"[m
[m
       And a template with the traditional wall-message format:[m
[m
              $template wallmsg,"\r\n\7Message from syslogd@%HOSTNAME% at %timegenerated%"[m
[m
       [1mA[0m [1mtemplate[0m [1mthat[0m [1mcan[0m [1mbe[0m [1mused[0m [1mfor[0m [1mwriting[0m [1mto[0m [1ma[0m [1mdatabase[0m [1m(please[0m [1mnote[0m [1mthe[0m [1mSQL[0m [1mtemplate[0m [1moption)[0m[m
[m
              $template MySQLInsert,"insert iut, message, receivedat values ('%iut%', '%msg:::UPPER‚Äê[m
              CASE%', '%timegenerated:::date-mysql%') into systemevents\r\n", SQL[m
[m
              NOTE 1: This template is embedded into core application under name [1mStdDBFmt[0m , so you don't[m
              need to define it.[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 375/663 68% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 376/663 68% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K...skipping...
[1m[7mPROPERTY[27m[0m [1mREPLACER[0m[m
       The [7mproperty[27m replacer is a core component in rsyslogd's output system. A syslog message has a num‚Äê[m
       ber of well-defined properties (see below). Each of this properties can be  accessed  and  manipu‚Äê[m
       lated by the [7mproperty[27m replacer. With it, it is easy to use only part of a [7mproperty[27m value or manip‚Äê[m
       ulate the value, e.g. by converting all characters to lower case.[m
[m
   [1mAccessing[0m [1mProperties[0m[m
       Syslog message properties are used inside templates. They are accessed  by  putting  them  between[m
       percent signs. Properties can be modified by the [7mproperty[27m replacer. The full syntax is as follows:[m
[m
              [1m%propname:fromChar:toChar:options%[0m[m
[m
       propname is the name of the [7mproperty[27m to access.  [1mIt[0m [1mis[0m [1mcase-sensitive.[0m[m
[m
   [1mAvailable[0m [1mProperties[0m[m
       [1mmsg[0m    the MSG part of the message (aka "the message" ;))[m
[m
       [1mrawmsg[0m the message exactly as it was received from the socket. Should be useful for debugging.[m
[m
       [1mHOSTNAME[0m[m
              hostname from the message[m
[m
       [1mFROMHOST[0m[m
              hostname  of the system the message was received from (in a relay chain, this is the system[m
              immediately in front of us and not necessarily the original sender)[m
[m
       [1msyslogtag[0m[m
              TAG from the message[m
[m
       [1mprogramname[0m[m
              the "static" part of the tag,  as  defined  by  BSD  syslogd.  For  example,  when  TAG  is[m
              "named[12345]", programname is "named".[m
[m
       [1mPRI[0m    PRI part of the message - undecoded (single value)[m
[m
       [1mPRI-text[0m[m
              the PRI part of the message in a textual form (e.g. "syslog.info")[m
[m
       [1mIUT[0m    the monitorware InfoUnitType - used when talking to a MonitorWare backend (also for phpLog‚Äê[m
              Con)[m
[m
       [1msyslogfacility[0m[m
              the facility from the message - in numerical form[m
[m
       [1msyslogfacility-text[0m[m
              the facility from the message - in text form[m
[m
       [1msyslogseverity[0m[m
              severity from the message - in numerical form[m
[m
       [1msyslogseverity-text[0m[m
              severity from the message - in text form[m
[m
       [1mtimegenerated[0m[m
              timestamp when the message was RECEIVED. Always in high resolution[m
[m
       [1mtimereported[0m[m
              timestamp from the message. Resolution depends on what was provided in the message (in most[m
              cases, only seconds)[m
[m
       [1mTIMESTAMP[0m[m
              alias for timereported[m
[m
       [1mPROTOCOL-VERSION[0m[m
              The contents of the PROTOCOL-VERSION field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 468/663 81% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 469/663 81% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       [1mSTRUCTURED-DATA[0m[m
              The contents of the STRUCTURED-DATA field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 471/663 81% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       [1mAPP-NAME[0m[m
              The contents of the APP-NAME field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1mPROCID[0m The contents of the PROCID field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 477/663 82% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       [1mMSGID[0m  The contents of the MSGID field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1m$NOW[0m   The current date stamp in the format YYYY-MM-DD[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 481/663 83% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K...skipping...
       become part of it.  If you are using regular expressions, the [7mproperty[27m replacer  will  return  the[m
       part  of the [7mproperty[27m text that matches the regular expression. An example for a [7mproperty[27m replacer[m
       sequence with a regular expression is: "%msg:R:.*Sev:. \(.*\) \[.*--end%"[m
[m
       Also, extraction can be done based on so-called "fields". To do so, place a "F" into  FromChar.  A[m
       field in its current definition is anything that is delimited by a delimiter character. The delim‚Äê[m
       iter by default is TAB (US-ASCII value 9). However, if can be changed to any other US-ASCII  char‚Äê[m
       acter  by specifying a comma and the decimal US-ASCII value of the delimiter immediately after the[m
       "F". For example, to use comma (",") as a delimiter, use this field specifier:  "F,44".   If  your[m
       syslog data is delimited, this is a quicker way to extract than via regular expressions (actually,[m
       a *much* quicker way). Field counting starts at 1. Field zero is accepted, but will always lead to[m
       a  "field not found" error. The same happens if a field number higher than the number of fields in[m
       the [7mproperty[27m is requested. The field number must be placed in the "ToChar" parameter.  An  example[m
       where  the  3rd  field  (delimited  by  TAB)  from  the  msg  [7mproperty[27m is extracted is as follows:[m
       "%msg:F:3%". The same example with semicolon as delimiter is "%msg:F,59:3%".[m
[m
       Please note that the special characters "F" and "R" are case-sensitive.  Only  upper  case  works,[m
       lower  case  will  return  an error. There are no white spaces permitted inside the sequence (that[m
       will lead to error messages and will NOT provide the intended result).[m
[m
   [1m[7mProperty[27m[0m [1mOptions[0m[m
       [7mProperty[27m options are case-insensitive. Currently, the following options are defined:[m
[m
       uppercase[m
              convert [7mproperty[27m to lowercase only[m
[m
       lowercase[m
              convert [7mproperty[27m text to uppercase only[m
[m
       drop-last-lf[m
              The last LF in the message (if any), is dropped. Especially useful for PIX.[m
[m
       date-mysql[m
              format as mysql date[m
[m
       date-rfc3164[m
              format as RFC 3164 date[m
[m
       date-rfc3339[m
              format as RFC 3339 date[m
[m
       escape-cc[m
              replace control characters (ASCII value 127  and  values  less  then  32)  with  an  escape[m
              sequence.  The  sequence  is "#<charval>" where charval is the 3-digit decimal value of the[m
              control character. For example, a tabulator would be replaced by "#009".[m
[m
       space-cc[m
              replace control characters by spaces[m
[m
       drop-cc[m
              drop control characters - the resulting string will  neither  contain  control  characters,[m
              escape sequences nor any other replacement character like space.[m
[m
[1mQUEUED[0m [1mOPERATIONS[0m[m
       Rsyslogd  supports  queued operations to handle offline outputs (like remote syslogd's or database[m
       servers being down). When running in queued mode, rsyslogd buffers messages to memory and  option‚Äê[m
       ally to disk (on an as-needed basis). Queues survive rsyslogd restarts.[m
[m
       It is highly suggested to use remote forwarding and database writing in queued mode, only.[m
[m
       To learn more about queued operations, see the html documentation.[m
[m
[1mFILES[0m[m
       [4m/etc/rsyslog.conf[24m[m
              Configuration file for [1mrsyslogd[0m[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 577/663 98% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 578/663 98% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[1mSEE[0m [1mALSO[0m[m
       [1mrsyslogd[0m(8), [1mlogger[0m(1), [1msyslog[0m(3)[m
[m
       The complete documentation can be found in the doc folder of the rsyslog distribution or online at[m
[m
              [1mhttp://www.rsyslog.com/doc[0m[m
[m
       Please note that the man page reflects only a subset of the configuration options. Be sure to read[m
       the html documentation for all features and details. This is especially vital if you plan  to  set[m
       up a more-then-extremely-simple system.[m

[HM       Discard is just the single tilde character with no further parameters.[m
[HM[m

[HM[m

[HM       *nix systems.  This file specifies rules for logging.  For special features see the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8)  manpage.[m
[HM       The  [4mrsyslog.conf[24m  file  is the main configuration file for the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8) which logs system messages on[m
[HM[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[HM[m

[HM[1mNAME[0m[m
[HM[m

page rsyslog.conf(5) line 1/663 9% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K55[K~~[K[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 1/663 9% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K55[K~~[K[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 1/663 9% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K55[K~~[K[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 1/663 9% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K...skipping...
       well with [7mproperty[27m-based filters, giving you great freedom in specifying what you do not want.[m
[m
       Discard is just the single tilde character with no further parameters.[m
[m
       [1mExample:[0m[m
              *.*   ~      # discards everything.[m
[m
   [1mOutput[0m [1mchannel[0m[m
       Binds  an output channel definition (see there for details) to this action. Output channel actions[m
       must start with a $-sign, e.g. if you would like to bind your output channel  definition  "mychan‚Äê[m
       nel"  to  the  action, use "$mychannel". Output channels support template definitions like all all[m
       other actions.[m
[m
   [1mShell[0m [1mexecute[0m[m
       This executes a program in a subshell. The program is passed the template-generated message as the[m
       only command line parameter. Rsyslog waits until the program terminates and only then continues to[m
       run.[m
[m
       [1mExample:[0m[m
              ^program-to-execute;template[m
[m
       The program-to-execute can be any valid executable. It receives the template string  as  a  single[m
       parameter (argv[1]).[m
[m
[1mFILTER[0m [1mCONDITIONS[0m[m
       Rsyslog offers three different types "filter conditions":[m
          * "traditional" severity and facility based selectors[m
          * [7mproperty[27m-based filters[m
          * expression-based filters[m
[m
   [1mSelectors[0m[m
       [1mSelectors[0m  [1mare[0m  [1mthe[0m  [1mtraditional[0m [1mway[0m [1mof[0m [1mfiltering[0m [1msyslog[0m [1mmessages.[0m  They have been kept in rsyslog[m
       with their original syntax, because it is well-known, highly effective and also needed for compat‚Äê[m
       ibility  with  stock syslogd configuration files. If you just need to filter based on priority and[m
       facility, you should do this with selector lines. They are not second-class  citizens  in  rsyslog[m
       and offer the best performance for this job.[m
[m
   [1m[7mProperty[27m[0m[1m-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
       [7mProperty[27m-based  filters  are  unique to rsyslogd. They allow to filter on any [7mproperty[27m, like HOST‚Äê[m
       NAME, syslogtag and msg.[m
[m
       A [7mproperty[27m-based filter must start with a colon in column 0. This tells rsyslogd that  it  is  the[m
       new filter type. The colon must be followed by the [7mproperty[27m name, a comma, the name of the compare[m
       operation to carry out, another comma and then the value to compare against. This  value  must  be[m
       quoted.   There  can  be spaces and tabs between the commas. [7mProperty[27m names and compare operations[m
       are case-sensitive, so "msg" works, while "MSG" is an invalid [7mproperty[27m name. In brief, the  syntax[m
       is as follows:[m
[m
              :[7mproperty[27m, [!]compare-operation, "value"[m
[m
       The following compare-operations are currently supported:[m
[m
              [1mcontains[0m[m
                     Checks if the string provided in value is contained in the [7mproperty[27m[m
[m
              [1misequal[0m[m
                     Compares  the  "value"  string  provided and the [7mproperty[27m contents. These two values[m
                     must be exactly equal to match.[m
[m
              [1mstartswith[0m[m
                     Checks if the value is found exactly at the beginning of the [7mproperty[27m value[m
[m
              [1mregex[0m[m
                     Compares the [7mproperty[27m against the provided regular expression.[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 259/663 49% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K   [1mExpression-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
       See the html documentation for this feature.[m
[m
[1mTEMPLATES[0m[m
       Every output in rsyslog uses templates - this holds true for files, user messages and so on.  Tem‚Äê[m
       plates  compatible  with  the stock syslogd formats are hardcoded into rsyslogd. If no template is[m
       specified, we use one of these hardcoded templates. Search for "template_" in  syslogd.c  and  you[m
       will find the hardcoded ones.[m
[m
       A  template  consists  of  a  template  directive,  a  name, the actual template text and optional[m
       options. A sample is:[m
[m
              [1m$template[0m [1mMyTemplateName,"\7Text[0m [1m%[0m[1m[7mproperty[27m[0m[1m%[0m [1msome[0m [1mmore[0m [1mtext\n",<options>[0m[m
[m
       The "$template" is the template directive. It tells rsyslog that this line  contains  a  template.[m
       The  backslash is an escape character. For example, \7 rings the bell (this is an ASCII value), \n[m
       is a new line. The set in rsyslog is a bit restricted currently.[m
[m
       All text in the template is used literally, except for things  within  percent  signs.  These  are[m
       properties and allow you access to the contents of the syslog message. Properties are accessed via[m
       the [7mproperty[27m replacer and it can for example pick a substring or do date-specific formatting. More[m
       on this is the [7mPROPERTY[27m REPLACER section of this manpage.[m
[m
       To escape:[m
          % = \%[m
          \ = \\ --> '\' is used to escape (as in C)[m
       $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%\n"[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 290/663 54% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       Properties can be accessed by the [7mproperty[27m replacer (see there for details).[m
[m
       [1mPlease[0m  [1mnote[0m  [1mthat[0m  [1mtemplates[0m [1mcan[0m [1malso[0m [1mby[0m [1mused[0m [1mto[0m [1mgenerate[0m [1mselector[0m [1mlines[0m [1mwith[0m [1mdynamic[0m [1mfile[0m [1mnames.[0m[m
       For example, if you would like to split syslog messages from different hosts  to  different  files[m
       (one per host), you can define the following template:[m
[m
              [1m$template[0m [1mDynFile,"/var/log/system-%HOSTNAME%.log"[0m[m
[m
       This  template can then be used when defining an output selector line. It will result in something[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 302/663 56% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       like "/var/log/system-localhost.log"[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 303/663 56% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
   [1mTemplate[0m [1moptions[0m[m
       The <options> part is optional. It carries options influencing the template as whole.  See details[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 306/663 56% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       below.  Be  sure  NOT  to mistake template options with [7mproperty[27m options - the later ones are pro‚Äê[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 307/663 57% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       cessed by the [7mproperty[27m replacer and apply to a SINGLE [7mproperty[27m, only (and not the whole template).[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 309/663 57% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       Template options are case-insensitive. Currently defined are:[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 310/663 57% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
              sql    format the string suitable for a SQL statement in MySQL format.  This  will  replace[m
                     single  quotes ("'") and the backslash character by their backslash-escaped counter‚Äê[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 313/663 58% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K                     part ("¬¥" and "\") inside each field. Please note that in MySQL  configuration,  the[m
                     NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES  mode  must  be turned off for this format to work (this is the[m
                     default).[m
[m
              stdsql format the string suitable for a SQL statement that is to be sent  to  a  standards-[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 318/663 59% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K                     compliant  sql  server.  This  will replace single quotes ("'") by two single quotes[m
                     ("''") inside each field.  You must use stdsql together with MySQL if in MySQL  con‚Äê[m
                     figuration the NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES is turned on.[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 321/663 60% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       Either  the  [1msql[0m or [1mstdsql[0m option [1mMUST[0m be specified when a template is used for writing to a data‚Äê[m
       base, otherwise injection might occur. Please note that due to the unfortunate fact  that  several[m
       vendors  have  violated the sql standard and introduced their own escape methods, it is impossible[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 325/663 61% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       to have a single option doing all the work.  So you yourself must make  sure  you  are  using  the[m
       right format.  [1mIf[0m [1myou[0m [1mchoose[0m [1mthe[0m [1mwrong[0m [1mone,[0m [1myou[0m [1mare[0m [1mstill[0m [1mvulnerable[0m [1mto[0m [1msql[0m [1minjection.[0m[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 328/663 62% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       Please  note  that the database writer *checks* that the sql option is present in the template. If[m
       it is not present, the write database action is disabled.  This is to guard you against accidental[m
       forgetting  it  and  then  becoming vulnerable to SQL injection. The sql option can also be useful[m
       with files - especially if you want to import them into a database on another machine for  perfor‚Äê[m
       mance  reasons.  However,  do  NOT use it if you do not have a real need for it - among others, it[m
       takes some toll on the processing time. Not much, but on a really busy system you might notice  it[m
       ;)[m
[m
       The default template for the write to database action has the sql option set.[m
[m
   [1mTemplate[0m [1mexamples[0m[m
       Please  note  that  the  samples  are split across multiple lines. A template MUST NOT actually be[m
       split across multiple lines.[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 345/663 64% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       A template that resembles traditional syslogd file output:[m
[m
              $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME%[m
              %syslogtag%%msg:::drop-last-lf%\n"[m
[m
       A template that tells you a little more about the message:[m
[m
              $template precise,"%syslogpriority%,%syslogfacility%,%timegenerated%,%HOSTNAME%,[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 353/663 65% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K              %syslogtag%,%msg%\n"[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 354/663 65% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       A template for RFC 3164 format:[m
[m
              $template RFC3164fmt,"<%PRI%>%TIMESTAMP% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%"[m
[m
       A template for the format traditionally used for user messages:[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 361/663 66% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K              $template usermsg," XXXX%syslogtag%%msg%\n\r"[m
[m
       And a template with the traditional wall-message format:[m
[m
              $template wallmsg,"\r\n\7Message from syslogd@%HOSTNAME% at %timegenerated%"[m
[m
       [1mA[0m [1mtemplate[0m [1mthat[0m [1mcan[0m [1mbe[0m [1mused[0m [1mfor[0m [1mwriting[0m [1mto[0m [1ma[0m [1mdatabase[0m [1m(please[0m [1mnote[0m [1mthe[0m [1mSQL[0m [1mtemplate[0m [1moption)[0m[m
[m
              $template MySQLInsert,"insert iut, message, receivedat values ('%iut%', '%msg:::UPPER‚Äê[m
              CASE%', '%timegenerated:::date-mysql%') into systemevents\r\n", SQL[m
[m
              NOTE 1: This template is embedded into core application under name [1mStdDBFmt[0m , so you don't[m
              need to define it.[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 375/663 68% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 376/663 68% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K...skipping...
[1m[7mPROPERTY[27m[0m [1mREPLACER[0m[m
       The [7mproperty[27m replacer is a core component in rsyslogd's output system. A syslog message has a num‚Äê[m
       ber of well-defined properties (see below). Each of this properties can be  accessed  and  manipu‚Äê[m
       lated by the [7mproperty[27m replacer. With it, it is easy to use only part of a [7mproperty[27m value or manip‚Äê[m
       ulate the value, e.g. by converting all characters to lower case.[m
[m
   [1mAccessing[0m [1mProperties[0m[m
       Syslog message properties are used inside templates. They are accessed  by  putting  them  between[m
       percent signs. Properties can be modified by the [7mproperty[27m replacer. The full syntax is as follows:[m
[m
              [1m%propname:fromChar:toChar:options%[0m[m
[m
       propname is the name of the [7mproperty[27m to access.  [1mIt[0m [1mis[0m [1mcase-sensitive.[0m[m
[m
   [1mAvailable[0m [1mProperties[0m[m
       [1mmsg[0m    the MSG part of the message (aka "the message" ;))[m
[m
       [1mrawmsg[0m the message exactly as it was received from the socket. Should be useful for debugging.[m
[m
       [1mHOSTNAME[0m[m
              hostname from the message[m
[m
       [1mFROMHOST[0m[m
              hostname  of the system the message was received from (in a relay chain, this is the system[m
              immediately in front of us and not necessarily the original sender)[m
[m
       [1msyslogtag[0m[m
              TAG from the message[m
[m
       [1mprogramname[0m[m
              the "static" part of the tag,  as  defined  by  BSD  syslogd.  For  example,  when  TAG  is[m
              "named[12345]", programname is "named".[m
[m
       [1mPRI[0m    PRI part of the message - undecoded (single value)[m
[m
       [1mPRI-text[0m[m
              the PRI part of the message in a textual form (e.g. "syslog.info")[m
[m
       [1mIUT[0m    the monitorware InfoUnitType - used when talking to a MonitorWare backend (also for phpLog‚Äê[m
              Con)[m
[m
       [1msyslogfacility[0m[m
              the facility from the message - in numerical form[m
[m
       [1msyslogfacility-text[0m[m
              the facility from the message - in text form[m
[m
       [1msyslogseverity[0m[m
              severity from the message - in numerical form[m
[m
       [1msyslogseverity-text[0m[m
              severity from the message - in text form[m
[m
       [1mtimegenerated[0m[m
              timestamp when the message was RECEIVED. Always in high resolution[m
[m
       [1mtimereported[0m[m
              timestamp from the message. Resolution depends on what was provided in the message (in most[m
              cases, only seconds)[m
[m
       [1mTIMESTAMP[0m[m
              alias for timereported[m
[m
       [1mPROTOCOL-VERSION[0m[m
              The contents of the PROTOCOL-VERSION field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 468/663 81% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 469/663 81% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K       [1mSTRUCTURED-DATA[0m[m
              The contents of the STRUCTURED-DATA field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 471/663 81% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       [1mAPP-NAME[0m[m
              The contents of the APP-NAME field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1mPROCID[0m The contents of the PROCID field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 477/663 82% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K[m
       [1mMSGID[0m  The contents of the MSGID field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1m$NOW[0m   The current date stamp in the format YYYY-MM-DD[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 481/663 83% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[K...skipping...
       become part of it.  If you are using regular expressions, the [7mproperty[27m replacer  will  return  the[m
       part  of the [7mproperty[27m text that matches the regular expression. An example for a [7mproperty[27m replacer[m
       sequence with a regular expression is: "%msg:R:.*Sev:. \(.*\) \[.*--end%"[m
[m
       Also, extraction can be done based on so-called "fields". To do so, place a "F" into  FromChar.  A[m
       field in its current definition is anything that is delimited by a delimiter character. The delim‚Äê[m
       iter by default is TAB (US-ASCII value 9). However, if can be changed to any other US-ASCII  char‚Äê[m
       acter  by specifying a comma and the decimal US-ASCII value of the delimiter immediately after the[m
       "F". For example, to use comma (",") as a delimiter, use this field specifier:  "F,44".   If  your[m
       syslog data is delimited, this is a quicker way to extract than via regular expressions (actually,[m
       a *much* quicker way). Field counting starts at 1. Field zero is accepted, but will always lead to[m
       a  "field not found" error. The same happens if a field number higher than the number of fields in[m
       the [7mproperty[27m is requested. The field number must be placed in the "ToChar" parameter.  An  example[m
       where  the  3rd  field  (delimited  by  TAB)  from  the  msg  [7mproperty[27m is extracted is as follows:[m
       "%msg:F:3%". The same example with semicolon as delimiter is "%msg:F,59:3%".[m
[m
       Please note that the special characters "F" and "R" are case-sensitive.  Only  upper  case  works,[m
       lower  case  will  return  an error. There are no white spaces permitted inside the sequence (that[m
       will lead to error messages and will NOT provide the intended result).[m
[m
   [1m[7mProperty[27m[0m [1mOptions[0m[m
       [7mProperty[27m options are case-insensitive. Currently, the following options are defined:[m
[m
       uppercase[m
              convert [7mproperty[27m to lowercase only[m
[m
       lowercase[m
              convert [7mproperty[27m text to uppercase only[m
[m
       drop-last-lf[m
              The last LF in the message (if any), is dropped. Especially useful for PIX.[m
[m
       date-mysql[m
              format as mysql date[m
[m
       date-rfc3164[m
              format as RFC 3164 date[m
[m
       date-rfc3339[m
              format as RFC 3339 date[m
[m
       escape-cc[m
              replace control characters (ASCII value 127  and  values  less  then  32)  with  an  escape[m
              sequence.  The  sequence  is "#<charval>" where charval is the 3-digit decimal value of the[m
              control character. For example, a tabulator would be replaced by "#009".[m
[m
       space-cc[m
              replace control characters by spaces[m
[m
       drop-cc[m
              drop control characters - the resulting string will  neither  contain  control  characters,[m
              escape sequences nor any other replacement character like space.[m
[m
[1mQUEUED[0m [1mOPERATIONS[0m[m
       Rsyslogd  supports  queued operations to handle offline outputs (like remote syslogd's or database[m
       servers being down). When running in queued mode, rsyslogd buffers messages to memory and  option‚Äê[m
       ally to disk (on an as-needed basis). Queues survive rsyslogd restarts.[m
[m
       It is highly suggested to use remote forwarding and database writing in queued mode, only.[m
[m
       To learn more about queued operations, see the html documentation.[m
[m
[1mFILES[0m[m
       [4m/etc/rsyslog.conf[24m[m
              Configuration file for [1mrsyslogd[0m[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 577/663 98% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       must  be followed by the string "--end". It denotes the end of the regular expression and will not[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 576/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       desired. The actual regular expression [1mmust[0m then be provided in  toChar.  The  regular  expression[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 575/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       Char.   This  tells  rsyslog  that  a  regular  expression instead of position-based extraction is[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 574/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       There is also support for [1mregular[0m [1mexpressions.[0m  To use them, you need to place a  "R"  into  From‚Äê[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 573/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 572/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       (e.g. %msg:10:$%, which will extract from position 10 to the end of the string).[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 571/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       extract  from  a position until the end of the string, you can place a dollar-sign ("$") in toChar[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 570/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       like to convert the full message text to lower case, use "%msg:::lowercase%". If you would like to[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 569/663 97% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       but  you  want to specify options, you still need to include the colons. For example, if you would[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 568/663 96% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       the message text, you can use this syntax: "%msg:1:2%". If you do not wish to specify from and to,[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 567/663 96% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       should  be copied. Offset counting starts at 1, so if you need to obtain the first 2 characters of[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 566/663 96% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       FromChar and toChar are used to build substrings. They specify the offset within the  string  that[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 565/663 96% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM   [1mCharacter[0m [1mPositions[0m[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 564/663 96% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 563/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       sage but are rather internally-generated.[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 561/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       Properties starting with a $-sign are so-called system properties. These do NOT stem from the mes‚Äê[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 560/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 559/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM              The current minute (2-digit)[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 557/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       [1m$MINUTE[0m[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 556/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 555/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       [1m$HOUR[0m  The current hour in military (24 hour) time (2-digit)[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 554/663 95% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 553/663 94% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       [1m$DAY[0m   The current day of the month (2-digit)[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 552/663 94% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 551/663 94% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       [1m$MONTH[0m The current month (2-digit)[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 550/663 94% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 549/663 94% (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       [1m$YEAR[0m  The current year (4-digit)[m

[1]+  Stopp√©                 vi /etc/rsyslog.d/appli1.conf
]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 12:08:47]# fgman rsyslog.confvi /etc/rsyslog.d/appli1.conf[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[C[13Pman rsyslog.conf
[?1049h[?1h=RSYSLOG.CONF(5)                            Linux System Administration                           RSYSLOG.CONF(5)[m
[m
[1mNAME[0m[m
       rsyslog.conf - rsyslogd(8) configuration file[m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       The  [4mrsyslog.conf[24m  file  is the main configuration file for the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8) which logs system messages on[m
       *nix systems.  This file specifies rules for logging.  For special features see the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8)  manpage.[m
       Rsyslog.conf is backward-compatible with sysklogd's syslog.conf file. So if you migrate from sysklogd you[m
       can rename it and it should work.[m
[m
       [1mNote[0m [1mthat[0m [1mthis[0m [1mversion[0m [1mof[0m [1mrsyslog[0m [1mships[0m [1mwith[0m [1mextensive[0m [1mdocumentation[0m [1min[0m [1mhtml[0m [1mformat.[0m  This is provided in[m
       the  ./doc  subdirectory and probably in a separate package if you installed rsyslog via a packaging sys‚Äê[m
       tem.  To use rsyslog's advanced features, you [1mneed[0m to look at the html  documentation,  because  the  man[m
       pages only cover basic aspects of operation.[m
[m
[1mMODULES[0m[m
       Rsyslog has a modular design. Consequently, there is a growing number of modules. See the html documenta‚Äê[m
       tion for their full description.[m
[m
       [4momsnmp[24m SNMP trap output module[m
[m
       [4momgssapi[24m[m
              Output module for GSS-enabled syslog[m
[m
       [4mommysql[24m[m
              Output module for MySQL[m
[m
       [4momrelp[24m Output module for the reliable RELP protocol (prevents message loss).  For details, see  below  at[m
              imrelp and the html documentation.  It can be used like this:[m
[m
              *.*  :omrelp:server:port[m
[m
              *.*  :omrelp:192.168.0.1:2514 # actual sample[m
[m
       [4mompgsql[24m[m
              Output module for PostgreSQL[m
[m
       [4momlibdbi[24m[m
              Generic database output module (Firebird/Interbase, MS SQL, Sybase, SQLite, Ingres, Oracle, mSQL)[m
[m
       [4mimfile[24m Input module for text files[m
[m
       [4mimudp[24m  Input plugin for UDP syslog. Replaces the deprecated -r option. Can be used like this:[m
[m
              $ModLoad imudp[m
[m
              $UDPServerRun 514[m
[m
       [4mimtcp[24m  Input plugin for plain TCP syslog. Replaces the deprecated -t option. Can be used like this:[m
[m
              $ModLoad imtcp[m
[m
              $InputTCPServerRun 514[m
[m
       [4mimrelp[24m Input  plugin for the RELP protocol. RELP can be used instead of UDP or plain TCP syslog to[m
              provide reliable delivery of syslog messages. Please note that plain TCP  syslog  does  NOT[m
              provide  truly  reliable  delivery, with it messages may be lost when there is a connection[m
              problem or the server shuts down.  RELP prevents message loss in those cases.   It  can  be[m
              used like this:[m
[m
              $ModLoad imrelp[m
[m
              $InputRELPServerRun 2514[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[KPP[Krr[Koo[Kpp[Kee[Krr[Ktt[Kyy[K[1;1HRSYSLOG.CONF(5)                            Linux System Administration                           RSYSLOG.CONF(5)[m
[2;1H[m

[66;1H[1;1HRSYSLOG.CONF(5)                            Linux System Administration                           RSYSLOG.CONF(5)[m

[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       rsyslog.conf - rsyslogd(8) configuration file[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[7;1H       The  [4mrsyslog.conf[24m  file  is the main configuration file for the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8) which logs system messages on[m
[8;1H       *nix systems.  This file specifies rules for logging.  For special features see the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8)  manpage.[m
[9;1H       Rsyslog.conf is backward-compatible with sysklogd's syslog.conf file. So if you migrate from sysklogd you[m
[10;1H       can rename it and it should work.[m
[11;1H[m
[12;1H       [1mNote[0m [1mthat[0m [1mthis[0m [1mversion[0m [1mof[0m [1mrsyslog[0m [1mships[0m [1mwith[0m [1mextensive[0m [1mdocumentation[0m [1min[0m [1mhtml[0m [1mformat.[0m  This is provided in[m
[13;1H       the  ./doc  subdirectory and probably in a separate package if you installed rsyslog via a packaging sys‚Äê[m
[14;1H       tem.  To use rsyslog's advanced features, you [1mneed[0m to look at the html  documentation,  because  the  man[m
[15;1H       pages only cover basic aspects of operation.[m

   [1m[7mProperty[27m[0m[1m-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
       [7mProperty[27m-based  filters  are  unique to rsyslogd. They allow to filter on any property, like HOST‚Äê[m
       NAME, syslogtag and msg.[m
[m
       A property-based filter must start with a colon in column 0. This tells rsyslogd that  it  is  the[m
       new filter type. The colon must be followed by the property name, a comma, the name of the compare[m
       operation to carry out, another comma and then the value to compare against. This  value  must  be[m
       quoted.   There  can  be spaces and tabs between the commas. [7mProperty[27m names and compare operations[m
       are case-sensitive, so "msg" works, while "MSG" is an invalid property name. In brief, the  syntax[m
       is as follows:[m
[m
              :property, [!]compare-operation, "value"[m
[m
       The following compare-operations are currently supported:[m
[m
              [1mcontains[0m[m
                     Checks if the string provided in value is contained in the property[m
[m
              [1misequal[0m[m
                     Compares  the  "value"  string  provided and the property contents. These two values[m
                     must be exactly equal to match.[m
[m
              [1mstartswith[0m[m
                     Checks if the value is found exactly at the beginning of the property value[m
[m
              [1mregex[0m[m
                     Compares the property against the provided regular expression.[m
[m
   [1mExpression-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
       See the html documentation for this feature.[m
[m
[1mTEMPLATES[0m[m
       Every output in rsyslog uses templates - this holds true for files, user messages and so on.  Tem‚Äê[m
       plates  compatible  with  the stock syslogd formats are hardcoded into rsyslogd. If no template is[m
       specified, we use one of these hardcoded templates. Search for "template_" in  syslogd.c  and  you[m
       will find the hardcoded ones.[m
[m
       A  template  consists  of  a  template  directive,  a  name, the actual template text and optional[m
       options. A sample is:[m
[m
              [1m$template[0m [1mMyTemplateName,"\7Text[0m [1m%property%[0m [1msome[0m [1mmore[0m [1mtext\n",<options>[0m[m
[m
       The "$template" is the template directive. It tells rsyslog that this line  contains  a  template.[m
       The  backslash is an escape character. For example, \7 rings the bell (this is an ASCII value), \n[m
       is a new line. The set in rsyslog is a bit restricted currently.[m
[m
       All text in the template is used literally, except for things  within  percent  signs.  These  are[m
       properties and allow you access to the contents of the syslog message. Properties are accessed via[m
       the property replacer and it can for example pick a substring or do date-specific formatting. More[m
       on this is the PROPERTY REPLACER section of this manpage.[m
[m
       To escape:[m
          % = \%[m
          \ = \\ --> '\' is used to escape (as in C)[m
       $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%\n"[m
[m
       Properties can be accessed by the property replacer (see there for details).[m
[m
       [1mPlease[0m  [1mnote[0m  [1mthat[0m  [1mtemplates[0m [1mcan[0m [1malso[0m [1mby[0m [1mused[0m [1mto[0m [1mgenerate[0m [1mselector[0m [1mlines[0m [1mwith[0m [1mdynamic[0m [1mfile[0m [1mnames.[0m[m
       For example, if you would like to split syslog messages from different hosts  to  different  files[m
       (one per host), you can define the following template:[m
[m
              [1m$template[0m [1mDynFile,"/var/log/system-%HOSTNAME%.log"[0m[m
[m
       This  template can then be used when defining an output selector line. It will result in something[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 302 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K[?1l>[?1049l]0;root@vm0:/home/romain.pereira[root@vm0 12:08:55]# fg
vi /etc/rsyslog.d/appli1.conf

:syslogfacility-text, , "value"

[?1049h[?1h=RSYSLOG.CONF(5)                            Linux System Administration                           RSYSLOG.CONF(5)[m

[1mNAME[0m[m
       rsyslog.conf - rsyslogd(8) configuration file[m
[m
[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
       The  [4mrsyslog.conf[24m  file  is the main configuration file for the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8) which logs system messages on[m
       *nix systems.  This file specifies rules for logging.  For special features see the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8)  manpage.[m
       Rsyslog.conf is backward-compatible with sysklogd's syslog.conf file. So if you migrate from sysklogd you[m
       can rename it and it should work.[m
[m
       [1mNote[0m [1mthat[0m [1mthis[0m [1mversion[0m [1mof[0m [1mrsyslog[0m [1mships[0m [1mwith[0m [1mextensive[0m [1mdocumentation[0m [1min[0m [1mhtml[0m [1mformat.[0m  This is provided in[m
       the  ./doc  subdirectory and probably in a separate package if you installed rsyslog via a packaging sys‚Äê[m
       tem.  To use rsyslog's advanced features, you [1mneed[0m to look at the html  documentation,  because  the  man[m
       pages only cover basic aspects of operation.[m
[m
[1mMODULES[0m[m
       Rsyslog has a modular design. Consequently, there is a growing number of modules. See the html documenta‚Äê[m
       tion for their full description.[m
[m
       [4momsnmp[24m SNMP trap output module[m
[m
       [4momgssapi[24m[m
              Output module for GSS-enabled syslog[m
[m
       [4mommysql[24m[m
              Output module for MySQL[m
[m
       [4momrelp[24m Output module for the reliable RELP protocol (prevents message loss).  For details, see  below  at[m
              imrelp and the html documentation.  It can be used like this:[m
[m
              *.*  :omrelp:server:port[m
[m
              *.*  :omrelp:192.168.0.1:2514 # actual sample[m
[m
       [4mompgsql[24m[m
              Output module for PostgreSQL[m
[m
       [4momlibdbi[24m[m
              Generic database output module (Firebird/Interbase, MS SQL, Sybase, SQLite, Ingres, Oracle, mSQL)[m
[m
       [4mimfile[24m Input module for text files[m
[m
       [4mimudp[24m  Input plugin for UDP syslog. Replaces the deprecated -r option. Can be used like this:[m
[m
              $ModLoad imudp[m
[m
              $UDPServerRun 514[m
[m
       [4mimtcp[24m  Input plugin for plain TCP syslog. Replaces the deprecated -t option. Can be used like this:[m
[m
              $ModLoad imtcp[m
[m
              $InputTCPServerRun 514[m
[m
       [4mimrelp[24m Input  plugin for the RELP protocol. RELP can be used instead of UDP or plain TCP syslog to[m
              provide reliable delivery of syslog messages. Please note that plain TCP  syslog  does  NOT[m
              provide  truly  reliable  delivery, with it messages may be lost when there is a connection[m
              problem or the server shuts down.  RELP prevents message loss in those cases.   It  can  be[m
              used like this:[m
[m
              $ModLoad imrelp[m
[m
              $InputRELPServerRun 2514[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 1 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K/[KPP[Krr[Koo[Kpp[Kee[Krr[Ktt[Kyy[K[1;1HRSYSLOG.CONF(5)                            Linux System Administration                           RSYSLOG.CONF(5)[m
[2;1H[m

[10;1H       can rename it and it should work.[m

[3;1H[1mNAME[0m[m
[4;1H       rsyslog.conf - rsyslogd(8) configuration file[m
[5;1H[m
[6;1H[1mDESCRIPTION[0m[m
[7;1H       The  [4mrsyslog.conf[24m  file  is the main configuration file for the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8) which logs system messages on[m
[8;1H       *nix systems.  This file specifies rules for logging.  For special features see the [1mrsyslogd[0m(8)  manpage.[m
[9;1H       Rsyslog.conf is backward-compatible with sysklogd's syslog.conf file. So if you migrate from sysklogd you[m
[10;1H       can rename it and it should work.[m
[11;1H[m
[12;1H       [1mNote[0m [1mthat[0m [1mthis[0m [1mversion[0m [1mof[0m [1mrsyslog[0m [1mships[0m [1mwith[0m [1mextensive[0m [1mdocumentation[0m [1min[0m [1mhtml[0m [1mformat.[0m  This is provided in[m
[13;1H       the  ./doc  subdirectory and probably in a separate package if you installed rsyslog via a packaging sys‚Äê[m
[14;1H       tem.  To use rsyslog's advanced features, you [1mneed[0m to look at the html  documentation,  because  the  man[m
[15;1H       pages only cover basic aspects of operation.[m

[30;1H              imrelp and the html documentation.  It can be used like this:[m

   [1m[7mProperty[27m[0m[1m-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
       [7mProperty[27m-based  filters  are  unique to rsyslogd. They allow to filter on any property, like HOST‚Äê[m
       NAME, syslogtag and msg.[m
[m
       A property-based filter must start with a colon in column 0. This tells rsyslogd that  it  is  the[m
       new filter type. The colon must be followed by the property name, a comma, the name of the compare[m
       operation to carry out, another comma and then the value to compare against. This  value  must  be[m
       quoted.   There  can  be spaces and tabs between the commas. [7mProperty[27m names and compare operations[m
       are case-sensitive, so "msg" works, while "MSG" is an invalid property name. In brief, the  syntax[m
       is as follows:[m
[m
              :property, [!]compare-operation, "value"[m
[m
       The following compare-operations are currently supported:[m
[m
              [1mcontains[0m[m
                     Checks if the string provided in value is contained in the property[m
[m
              [1misequal[0m[m
                     Compares  the  "value"  string  provided and the property contents. These two values[m
                     must be exactly equal to match.[m
[m
              [1mstartswith[0m[m
                     Checks if the value is found exactly at the beginning of the property value[m
[m
              [1mregex[0m[m
                     Compares the property against the provided regular expression.[m
[m
   [1mExpression-Based[0m [1mFilters[0m[m
       See the html documentation for this feature.[m
[m
[1mTEMPLATES[0m[m
       Every output in rsyslog uses templates - this holds true for files, user messages and so on.  Tem‚Äê[m
       plates  compatible  with  the stock syslogd formats are hardcoded into rsyslogd. If no template is[m
       specified, we use one of these hardcoded templates. Search for "template_" in  syslogd.c  and  you[m
       will find the hardcoded ones.[m
[m
       A  template  consists  of  a  template  directive,  a  name, the actual template text and optional[m
       options. A sample is:[m
[m
              [1m$template[0m [1mMyTemplateName,"\7Text[0m [1m%property%[0m [1msome[0m [1mmore[0m [1mtext\n",<options>[0m[m
[m
       The "$template" is the template directive. It tells rsyslog that this line  contains  a  template.[m
       The  backslash is an escape character. For example, \7 rings the bell (this is an ASCII value), \n[m
       is a new line. The set in rsyslog is a bit restricted currently.[m
[m
       All text in the template is used literally, except for things  within  percent  signs.  These  are[m
       properties and allow you access to the contents of the syslog message. Properties are accessed via[m
       the property replacer and it can for example pick a substring or do date-specific formatting. More[m
       on this is the PROPERTY REPLACER section of this manpage.[m
[m
       To escape:[m
          % = \%[m
          \ = \\ --> '\' is used to escape (as in C)[m
       $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%\n"[m
[m
       Properties can be accessed by the property replacer (see there for details).[m
[m
       [1mPlease[0m  [1mnote[0m  [1mthat[0m  [1mtemplates[0m [1mcan[0m [1malso[0m [1mby[0m [1mused[0m [1mto[0m [1mgenerate[0m [1mselector[0m [1mlines[0m [1mwith[0m [1mdynamic[0m [1mfile[0m [1mnames.[0m[m
       For example, if you would like to split syslog messages from different hosts  to  different  files[m
       (one per host), you can define the following template:[m
[m
              [1m$template[0m [1mDynFile,"/var/log/system-%HOSTNAME%.log"[0m[m
[m
       This  template can then be used when defining an output selector line. It will result in something[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 302 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K66[K~~[K       like "/var/log/system-localhost.log"[m
[m
   [1mTemplate[0m [1moptions[0m[m
       The <options> part is optional. It carries options influencing the template as whole.  See details[m
       below.  Be  sure  NOT  to mistake template options with property options - the later ones are pro‚Äê[m
       cessed by the property replacer and apply to a SINGLE property, only (and not the whole template).[m
[m
       Template options are case-insensitive. Currently defined are:[m
[m
              sql    format the string suitable for a SQL statement in MySQL format.  This  will  replace[m
                     single  quotes ("'") and the backslash character by their backslash-escaped counter‚Äê[m
                     part ("¬¥" and "\") inside each field. Please note that in MySQL  configuration,  the[m
                     NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES  mode  must  be turned off for this format to work (this is the[m
                     default).[m
[m
              stdsql format the string suitable for a SQL statement that is to be sent  to  a  standards-[m
                     compliant  sql  server.  This  will replace single quotes ("'") by two single quotes[m
                     ("''") inside each field.  You must use stdsql together with MySQL if in MySQL  con‚Äê[m
                     figuration the NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES is turned on.[m
[m
       Either  the  [1msql[0m or [1mstdsql[0m option [1mMUST[0m be specified when a template is used for writing to a data‚Äê[m
       base, otherwise injection might occur. Please note that due to the unfortunate fact  that  several[m
       vendors  have  violated the sql standard and introduced their own escape methods, it is impossible[m
       to have a single option doing all the work.  So you yourself must make  sure  you  are  using  the[m
       right format.  [1mIf[0m [1myou[0m [1mchoose[0m [1mthe[0m [1mwrong[0m [1mone,[0m [1myou[0m [1mare[0m [1mstill[0m [1mvulnerable[0m [1mto[0m [1msql[0m [1minjection.[0m[m
[m
       Please  note  that the database writer *checks* that the sql option is present in the template. If[m
       it is not present, the write database action is disabled.  This is to guard you against accidental[m
       forgetting  it  and  then  becoming vulnerable to SQL injection. The sql option can also be useful[m
       with files - especially if you want to import them into a database on another machine for  perfor‚Äê[m
       mance  reasons.  However,  do  NOT use it if you do not have a real need for it - among others, it[m
       takes some toll on the processing time. Not much, but on a really busy system you might notice  it[m
       ;)[m
[m
       The default template for the write to database action has the sql option set.[m
[m
   [1mTemplate[0m [1mexamples[0m[m
       Please  note  that  the  samples  are split across multiple lines. A template MUST NOT actually be[m
       split across multiple lines.[m
[m
       A template that resembles traditional syslogd file output:[m
[m
              $template TraditionalFormat,"%timegenerated% %HOSTNAME%[m
              %syslogtag%%msg:::drop-last-lf%\n"[m
[m
       A template that tells you a little more about the message:[m
[m
              $template precise,"%syslogpriority%,%syslogfacility%,%timegenerated%,%HOSTNAME%,[m
              %syslogtag%,%msg%\n"[m
[m
       A template for RFC 3164 format:[m
[m
              $template RFC3164fmt,"<%PRI%>%TIMESTAMP% %HOSTNAME% %syslogtag%%msg%"[m
[m
       A template for the format traditionally used for user messages:[m
[m
              $template usermsg," XXXX%syslogtag%%msg%\n\r"[m
[m
       And a template with the traditional wall-message format:[m
[m
              $template wallmsg,"\r\n\7Message from syslogd@%HOSTNAME% at %timegenerated%"[m
[m
       [1mA[0m [1mtemplate[0m [1mthat[0m [1mcan[0m [1mbe[0m [1mused[0m [1mfor[0m [1mwriting[0m [1mto[0m [1ma[0m [1mdatabase[0m [1m(please[0m [1mnote[0m [1mthe[0m [1mSQL[0m [1mtemplate[0m [1moption)[0m[m
[m
              $template MySQLInsert,"insert iut, message, receivedat values ('%iut%', '%msg:::UPPER‚Äê[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 370 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K66[K~~[K              CASE%', '%timegenerated:::date-mysql%') into systemevents\r\n", SQL[m
[m
              NOTE 1: This template is embedded into core application under name [1mStdDBFmt[0m , so you don't[m
              need to define it.[m
[m
              NOTE 2: You have to have MySQL module installed to use this template.[m
[m
[1mOUTPUT[0m [1mCHANNELS[0m[m
       Output Channels are a new concept first introduced in rsyslog 0.9.0. As of  this  writing,  it  is[m
       most  likely that they will be replaced by something different in the future.  So if you use them,[m
       be prepared to change you configuration file syntax when you upgrade to a later release.[m
[m
       Output channels are defined via an $outchannel directive. It's syntax is as follows:[m
[m
              [1m$outchannel[0m [1mname,file-name,max-size,action-on-max-size[0m[m
[m
       name is the name of the output channel (not the file), file-name is the file name  to  be  written[m
       to,  max-size  the maximum allowed size and action-on-max-size a command to be issued when the max[m
       size is reached. This command always has exactly one parameter. The binary is that part of action-[m
       on-max-size before the first space, its parameter is everything behind that space.[m
[m
       Keep  in mind that $outchannel just defines a channel with "name". It does not activate it.  To do[m
       so, you must use a selector line (see below). That selector line includes the  channel  name  plus[m
       ":omfile:$" in front of it. A sample might be:[m
[m
              *.* :omfile:$mychannel[m
[m
[1mPROPERTY[0m [1mREPLACER[0m[m
       The property replacer is a core component in rsyslogd's output system. A syslog message has a num‚Äê[m
       ber of well-defined properties (see below). Each of this properties can be  accessed  and  manipu‚Äê[m
       lated by the property replacer. With it, it is easy to use only part of a property value or manip‚Äê[m
       ulate the value, e.g. by converting all characters to lower case.[m
[m
   [1mAccessing[0m [1mProperties[0m[m
       Syslog message properties are used inside templates. They are accessed  by  putting  them  between[m
       percent signs. Properties can be modified by the property replacer. The full syntax is as follows:[m
[m
              [1m%propname:fromChar:toChar:options%[0m[m
[m
       propname is the name of the property to access.  [1mIt[0m [1mis[0m [1mcase-sensitive.[0m[m
[m
   [1mAvailable[0m [1mProperties[0m[m
       [1mmsg[0m    the MSG part of the message (aka "the message" ;))[m
[m
       [1mrawmsg[0m the message exactly as it was received from the socket. Should be useful for debugging.[m
[m
       [1mHOSTNAME[0m[m
              hostname from the message[m
[m
       [1mFROMHOST[0m[m
              hostname  of the system the message was received from (in a relay chain, this is the system[m
              immediately in front of us and not necessarily the original sender)[m
[m
       [1msyslogtag[0m[m
              TAG from the message[m
[m
       [1mprogramname[0m[m
              the "static" part of the tag,  as  defined  by  BSD  syslogd.  For  example,  when  TAG  is[m
              "named[12345]", programname is "named".[m
[m
       [1mPRI[0m    PRI part of the message - undecoded (single value)[m
[m
       [1mPRI-text[0m[m
              the PRI part of the message in a textual form (e.g. "syslog.info")[m
[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 439 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[K[[[K66[K~~[K       [1mIUT[0m    the monitorware InfoUnitType - used when talking to a MonitorWare backend (also for phpLog‚Äê[m
              Con)[m
[m
       [1msyslogfacility[0m[m
              the facility from the message - in numerical form[m
[m
       [1msyslogfacility-text[0m[m
              the facility from the message - in text form[m
[m
       [1msyslogseverity[0m[m
              severity from the message - in numerical form[m
[m
       [1msyslogseverity-text[0m[m
              severity from the message - in text form[m
[m
       [1mtimegenerated[0m[m
              timestamp when the message was RECEIVED. Always in high resolution[m
[m
       [1mtimereported[0m[m
              timestamp from the message. Resolution depends on what was provided in the message (in most[m
              cases, only seconds)[m
[m
       [1mTIMESTAMP[0m[m
              alias for timereported[m
[m
       [1mPROTOCOL-VERSION[0m[m
              The contents of the PROTOCOL-VERSION field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1mSTRUCTURED-DATA[0m[m
              The contents of the STRUCTURED-DATA field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1mAPP-NAME[0m[m
              The contents of the APP-NAME field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1mPROCID[0m The contents of the PROCID field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1mMSGID[0m  The contents of the MSGID field from IETF draft draft-ietf-syslog-protocol[m
[m
       [1m$NOW[0m   The current date stamp in the format YYYY-MM-DD[m
[m
       [1m$YEAR[0m  The current year (4-digit)[m
[m
       [1m$MONTH[0m The current month (2-digit)[m
[m
       [1m$DAY[0m   The current day of the month (2-digit)[m
[m
       [1m$HOUR[0m  The current hour in military (24 hour) time (2-digit)[m
[m
       [1m$MINUTE[0m[m
              The current minute (2-digit)[m
[m
       Properties starting with a $-sign are so-called system properties. These do NOT stem from the mes‚Äê[m
       sage but are rather internally-generated.[m
[m
   [1mCharacter[0m [1mPositions[0m[m
       FromChar and toChar are used to build substrings. They specify the offset within the  string  that[m
       should  be copied. Offset counting starts at 1, so if you need to obtain the first 2 characters of[m
       the message text, you can use this syntax: "%msg:1:2%". If you do not wish to specify from and to,[m
       but  you  want to specify options, you still need to include the colons. For example, if you would[m
       like to convert the full message text to lower case, use "%msg:::lowercase%". If you would like to[m
       extract  from  a position until the end of the string, you can place a dollar-sign ("$") in toChar[m
       (e.g. %msg:10:$%, which will extract from position 10 to the end of the string).[m
[m
       There is also support for [1mregular[0m [1mexpressions.[0m  To use them, you need to place a  "R"  into  From‚Äê[m
       Char.   This  tells  rsyslog  that  a  regular  expression instead of position-based extraction is[m
[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 508 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 507 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM              the PRI part of the message in a textual form (e.g. "syslog.info")[m
[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 506 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM       [1mPRI-text[0m[m

[66;1H[K[7m Manual page rsyslog.conf(5) line 503 (press h for help or q to quit)[27m[K[K [KESCESC[KOO[KAA[K[HM[m
